Suave Crimson Peacock

medium

# DOS if Voting Threshold is Zero or Very Large in `RFPCommitteeStrategy::allocate()`
## Summary

According to the initialization function of the If the `RFPCommitteeStrategy`, voting threshold can be set to anything (even zero). voting Threshold is set to zero or set to very large number, then the `RFPCommitteeStrategy::allocate()` will never work and `acceptedRecipientId` will always remain address zero.

## Vulnerability Detail

`RFPCommitteeStrategy::allocate()` function depends on the votes of the manager in order to set the `acceptedRecipientId`. This `acceptedRecipientId` will be set only if the `votingThreshold` is met. But when the threshold is set to zero or set to very large number (technically a number more than the number of pool managers), then the function will never work because of the following check:


https://github.com/sherlock-audit/2023-09-Gitcoin/blob/main/allo-v2/contracts/strategies/rfp-committee/RFPCommitteeStrategy.sol#L126-L137

According to the above check `acceptedRecipientId` will be set when `votes[recipientId] == voteThreshold`. If the threshold is zero then this condition will never met because votes[recipientId] gets incremented before this check on the following line:


https://github.com/sherlock-audit/2023-09-Gitcoin/blob/main/allo-v2/contracts/strategies/rfp-committee/RFPCommitteeStrategy.sol#L118

The same is also true when the threshold is a large number. Because there are less managers than the threshold this condition will never met as `votes[recipientId]` will never become more than the threshold. Only way to make this work is if we add more managers in the pool. But adding more managers means giving more power to more people and that means more risk of theft and attacks. So it should never be the case.

Also there is no function in the contract to set this threshold after initialization.

## Impact

Important functions like `RFPCommitteeStrategy::submitUpcomingMilestone()`, `RFPCommitteeStrategy::distribute()` etc. depends on `accpetedRecipientId`. If this is not set these function will not work. That means `poolOwner` will have to withdraw the funds and will have to deploy new strategy again.

## Code Snippet

_RFPCommitteeStrategy::allocate()_
https://github.com/sherlock-audit/2023-09-Gitcoin/blob/main/allo-v2/contracts/strategies/rfp-committee/RFPCommitteeStrategy.sol#L102-L139

#### Tests for POC

Test when Threshold is zero

```Javascript
       function test_allocateWouldNeverWorkIfVotingThresholdIsZero() public {
        vm.recordLogs();
        // owners and members
        address manager1 = makeAddr("manager_1");
        address manager2 = makeAddr("manager_2");
        address manager3 = makeAddr("manager_3");
        address manager4 = makeAddr("manager_4");
        address profileOwner = makeAddr("profile_Ownerr");
        address recipient = makeAddr("recipient__1");

        address[] memory poolManagers = new address[](4);
        poolManagers[0] = manager1;
        poolManagers[1] = manager2;
        poolManagers[2] = manager3;
        poolManagers[3] = manager4;

        // creating profile for the pool owner
        vm.prank(profileOwner);
        bytes32 newProfileId = registry().createProfile(
            0, "New Pool 1", Metadata({protocol: 1, pointer: "Profile Metadata 1"}), profileOwner, profile1_members()
        );

        // deploying the strategy
        vm.prank(profileOwner);
        RFPCommitteeStrategy testStrategy2 = new RFPCommitteeStrategy(address(allo()), "committe strategy 2");

        // setting voteTreshold to 0
        bytes memory dataForInitialization = abi.encode(
            RFPCommitteeStrategy.InitializeParamsCommittee({
                voteThreshold: 0,
                params: RFPSimpleStrategy.InitializeParams({
                    maxBid: 10 ether,
                    useRegistryAnchor: false,
                    metadataRequired: true
                })
            })
        );

        // profie owner creates pool
        // for simplicity, i have deployed the strategy with createPoolWithCustomStrategy() instead
        // of adding it to the cloneable strategies and then creating the pool with createPool()
        vm.startPrank(profileOwner);
        uint256 newPoolId = allo().createPoolWithCustomStrategy(
            newProfileId,
            address(testStrategy2),
            dataForInitialization,
            address(token),
            0,
            Metadata({protocol: 1, pointer: "Create Pool Metadata"}),
            poolManagers
        );

        // deployed strategy should have correct pool id
        assertEq(testStrategy2.getPoolId(), newPoolId);

        // registering recipient
        address recipientId = _register_recipient(newPoolId, testStrategy2, recipient, profileOwner);

        // data for allocate function
        bytes memory _data = abi.encode(recipientId, 10 ether, Metadata({protocol: 1, pointer: "allocate metadata"}));

        // calling allocate for each pool manager
        // proving that setting voting threshold to zero would not work as it would never reach
        // 0 because when allocate() is called it will add one vote to the called reciepientId
        // and the allocating condition will never met.

        for (uint256 i; i < poolManagers.length; i++) {
            vm.startPrank(poolManagers[i]);
            allo().allocate(newPoolId, _data);
            vm.stopPrank();
        }

        // will always be address 0
        assertEq(testStrategy2.acceptedRecipientId(), address(0));
    }

```

Test When threshold is large value

```Javascript
    function test_allocateWouldNeverWorkIfVotingThresholdIsMoreThanTheNumberOfManagers() public {
        // owners and members
        address manager1 = makeAddr("manager_1");
        address manager2 = makeAddr("manager_2");
        address manager3 = makeAddr("manager_3");
        address manager4 = makeAddr("manager_4");
        address profileOwner = makeAddr("profile_Ownerr");
        address recipient = makeAddr("recipient__1");

        address[] memory poolManagers = new address[](4);
        poolManagers[0] = manager1;
        poolManagers[1] = manager2;
        poolManagers[2] = manager3;
        poolManagers[3] = manager4;

        // creating profile for the pool owner
        vm.prank(profileOwner);
        bytes32 newProfileId = registry().createProfile(
            0, "New Pool 1", Metadata({protocol: 1, pointer: "Profile Metadata 1"}), profileOwner, profile1_members()
        );

        // deploying the strategy
        vm.prank(profileOwner);
        RFPCommitteeStrategy testStrategy2 = new RFPCommitteeStrategy(address(allo()), "committe strategy 2");

        // setting voteTreshold to 50 (could be very big nubmer as well) that is more than the current number of managers
        // the voting threshould will never met and allocation will never happen
        bytes memory dataForInitialization = abi.encode(
            RFPCommitteeStrategy.InitializeParamsCommittee({
                voteThreshold: 50,
                params: RFPSimpleStrategy.InitializeParams({
                    maxBid: 10 ether,
                    useRegistryAnchor: false,
                    metadataRequired: true
                })
            })
        );

        // profie owner creates pool
        // for simplicity, i have deployed the strategy with createPoolWithCustomStrategy() instead
        // of adding it to the cloneable strategies and then creating the pool with createPool()
        vm.startPrank(profileOwner);
        uint256 newPoolId = allo().createPoolWithCustomStrategy(
            newProfileId,
            address(testStrategy2),
            dataForInitialization,
            address(token),
            0,
            Metadata({protocol: 1, pointer: "Create Pool Metadata"}),
            poolManagers
        );

        // deployed strategy should have correct pool id
        assertEq(testStrategy2.getPoolId(), newPoolId);

        // profile owner registers one recipient in the registry
        address recipientId = _register_recipient(newPoolId, testStrategy2, recipient, profileOwner);

        // data for allocate function
        bytes memory _data = abi.encode(recipientId, 10 ether, Metadata({protocol: 1, pointer: "allocate metadata"}));

        // calling allocate for each pool manager
        // proving that setting voting threshold to zero would not work as it would never reach
        // 0 because when allocate() is called it will add one vote to the called reciepientId
        // and the allocating condition will never met.
        for (uint256 i; i < poolManagers.length; i++) {
            vm.startPrank(poolManagers[i]);
            allo().allocate(newPoolId, _data);
            vm.stopPrank();
        }

        // will always be address 0
        assertEq(testStrategy2.acceptedRecipientId(), address(0));
    }
```

#### Helper functions used by both tests
```Javascript
    function _setMilestones(RFPCommitteeStrategy _strategy, address poolManager) internal {
        vm.stopPrank();
        RFPCommitteeStrategy.Milestone[] memory milestones = new RFPCommitteeStrategy.Milestone[](1);
        RFPCommitteeStrategy.Milestone memory milestone = RFPSimpleStrategy.Milestone({
            metadata: Metadata({protocol: 1, pointer: "metadata"}),
            amountPercentage: 1e18,
            milestoneStatus: IStrategy.Status.Pending
        });

        milestones[0] = milestone;

        vm.prank(poolManager);
        _strategy.setMilestones(milestones);
    }

    function _register_recipient(uint256 poolId, RFPCommitteeStrategy _strategy, address recipient, address caller)
        internal
        returns (address recipientId)
    {
        Metadata memory metadata = Metadata({protocol: 1, pointer: "metadata"});

        bytes memory data = abi.encode(recipient, address(0), 1e18, metadata);
        vm.startPrank(caller);
        recipientId = allo().registerRecipient(poolId, data);
    }
```

## Tool used

Manual Review

## Recommendation

There are two ways to solve the problem.
1. Add new variable for Min and Max values for the `votingThreshold` and peroform checks if it is between those values or not
For example:
```diff

    function __RPFCommiteeStrategy_init(uint256 _poolId, InitializeParamsCommittee memory _initializeParamsCommittee)
        internal
    {
        console.log("RPF commitee:: pool id sent %s", _poolId);
        // Initialize the RFPSimpleStrategy
        __RFPSimpleStrategy_init(_poolId, _initializeParamsCommittee.params);

        // Set the strategy specific variables

+        if(_initializeParamsCommittee.voteThreshold < minThreshold || _initializeParamsCommittee.voteThreshold > maxThreshold) revert();
        voteThreshold = _initializeParamsCommittee.voteThreshold;
    }
```
2.  Or add a function to update the `votingThreshold` after it has been set during initilization
